title: Intensive Short Course in Introduction to Psychology: Core Theories and Applications

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level foundational knowledge in general psychology
context.additional_context: Emphasizes foundational theory comprehension for non-majors and applied competencies through practical tasks, promoting self-directed learning in online environments.

learning_goals: Learners distinguish and explain the five major psychological theories (behaviorism, cognitivism, psychoanalysis, etc.).
Learners analyze real-life cases and apply psychological theories (social learning theory, cognitive dissonance, etc.).
Learners achieve an 80% or higher correct answer rate on LMS-based formative assessments (quizzes, discussions).
Learners systematically organize learning content through peer feedback and self-reflection reports.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
